Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can illustrate a device that allows people to communicate over a distance using sound.
The student can show through the drawing how a string telephone works, using cups and string.
The student can depict the transfer of sound from one cup to another through the string, including elements like vibrations or annotations indicating sound travel.
The student can include details to show that the device uses sound to send messages, such as waves or lines emanating from the cup.
The student can display an understanding that the string must be tight for the sound to travel effectively, possibly with annotations or taut string depiction.
The student can illustrate people using the device to communicate from different locations, demonstrating the concept of distance communication.
CANNOT: The student may not perfectly label every part of the diagram (e.g., missing labels or minor typos).
The student might not consistently show one advanced feature (e.g., varying the thickness of the string to match sound transmission strength).
